div.l: Wele ought a man avised · for to be
Whom that he brȳngeth · in to his privite
I pray to god · so yeve me sorow and care
If eủer sith I hight · hogge of ware
Herd I a Miller · better sette a werke
He had a Iape of Malice in the derk
But god forbede · that we stynten here
For if ye fouchesauf · for to here
A tale of me · that am a poore man
I wil yow telle · as wele as eủery can
A litel Iape · that fel in oure Citee
Oure hoste aunswerd · and saide I graunt it the
Now telle on Roger and loke that it be goode
For many a pasty · hastow lete bloode
And many a Iakke of Douer · hastow sold
That hath bien twyes hote and twyes cold
Of many a pilgrym · hastow cristes Curs
For of thy ꝑpercely · yit they fare the wurs
That they have eeten · with the stubbil goos
For in thi shoppe · is many a flye loos
Now tel on gentil Roger · be thy name
But I pᵃray the · be nat wroth for game
A man may sey ful soth · in game and pley
Thow seist ful soth · quod Roger be my fey
Soth pley quade pley · as the fleamyng seith
And therfor herry BailyBalyBaily · be thy feith
Be thow nat wroth · or we departen here
Though that my tale · be of an hostilere
But natheles · I wil nat tel it yit
